title: Add configureable auto-delete for downloaded files
body:
Hi,

When I use the android app to `move` files from my android device to my ownCloud installation, the files are not deleted from the android device but merely moved to the owncloud folder. Thus the files are marked as "downloaded" in the app and still consume space.

I know there are several issues about really moving the files and deleting them locally. I know the workaround to use the ownCloud app to delete them locally.

How about a (globally configurable) retention time for downloaded files?

What I'd like to see configurable:
* Globally turning on and off deletion after the retention for all downloaded files
* Setting a global retention time after which all downloaded files get deleted if the server version still exists and is identical with the downloaded version.

Thanks for considering,
Cheers,
Thomas

title: "Local copy could not be renamed; try a different name" when connecting for first time
body:
### Actual behaviour
When setting up owncloud on Android phone for the first time the message "Local copy could not be renamed; try a different name" appears after accepting the server certificate (in my case I have a self generated ssl certificate)

### Expected behaviour
Configuration should complete without errors.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install owncloud for Android
2. Open, enter configuration information for server.   Mine is a "https://xxxx.dyndns.org" 
3. Observe error message (can't take a screenshot either)

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
No - connects okay.   Can I delete a local file on the phone that is corrupted?

### Environment data
Android version:
8.0.0
Device model: 
LG G7 ThinQ

Stock or customized system:
N/A
ownCloud app version:
2.8.0
ownCloud server version:
10.0.0.8

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
Insert your ownCloud log here
```

title: Update oc jb workaround version for 2.8.0 release
App cannot open folders with name that contains a space
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
When trying to open folder or upload to folders containing space in their name, the app fails to do so. For example opening folder "My Files" will not work, whereas "My-Files" will be opened.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
 The app should open folders containing a space in their name.

### Steps to reproduce
1.Make a folder with space in the name 
2. Try to open it


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)


### Environment data
Android version: Lineage OS 15.1 (Oreo)

Device model: Xiaomi Redmi Note 5 Pro

Stock or customized system: Customized

ownCloud app version: version 2.7.0

ownCloud server version: 10.0.9

title: Inappropriate Message when creating a folder with an existing folder name
body:
### Actual behaviour
When trying to create a folder with the same name as one that has already been created. The snackbar message states "Method not allowed". 

### Expected behaviour
I think the message should be a bit more informative like "Folder with same name exists" of another forlder should be created with suffix "<folder name> + 1".

### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a folder named "xyz" by selecting option from the FAB in FileDisplayActivity.
2. Create another folder with the name "xyz" following the similar procedure.

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
Yes.

![41779120-6f65b99a-764e-11e8-9eaf-2eaa7eb93e5c](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/41834718-8217ef50-7855-11e8-891e-79c32fe2b65d.png)

title: "Available offline" does not seem to work
body:
### Actual behaviour
When a folder is flagged as "Avalable offline", it is assumed to be updated automatically (within a reasonable amount of time) when a file in this folder changes on the server.

This doesn't seem to work for me on all of my devices:
Samsung Note 10.1 (GT-N8010) with LineageOS 14.1 (Android 7.1)
Samsung A3 (A320FL) with Oreo 8.0
Asus Zenpad Z300M with Android 7.0

As soon as the ownCloud app is opened on the device, synching takes place.

### Expected behaviour
Synching should take place regardless of opening the app.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Mark a folder on the device as "available offline". It will be updated.
2. Modify on a PC a file in this folder. It will be uploaded to the server.
3. Watch the device (e.g., via an ssh connection) and see that the file is not updated even after a long time (over one hour).
4. Open the ownCloud app, the file is updated immediately (provided there is a network connection).

### Environment data
Android version: See above.

Device model: See above.

Stock or customized system:
GT-N8010: Custom.
A320FL and Z300M: stock.

ownCloud app version:
2.7.0

ownCloud server version:
10.0.8

### Logs
#### Web server error log
n/a
#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
n/a
Insert your ownCloud log here
n/a

title: OAuth2 + multiaccount
body:
Currently it's not quite an easy task to do if you want to login into 2 or more accounts at the same server.

Because after accessing the first account you are still loged  in your browser, and you get directly redirected to the authorise view:
![screenshot_1528803133](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/41288133-8a939ebe-6e45-11e8-9d36-9936269105c6.png)

If you now want to login into a different account now, you have to open your browser, and log out manually.

Currently is posible in server side to send the user you want to authenticate in the authorization request, thanks to the fix in https://github.com/owncloud/oauth2/pull/60

title: [2.8.0] New release
body:
### TASKS
- [x] [WIZARD] Create new steps with important features included in 2.8.0 https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2244
- [x] [COORDINATION] Ping community guys to publish a blog post, at least one week before releasing.
 - [x] [GIT] Create branch release_0.9.20 in owncloud/android-library from master, if needed
 - [x] [GIT] Create branch release_2.8.0 in owncloud/android from master 
 - [x] [DEV] Update version number and name in build.gradle in android module
 - [x] [DEV] Update version number and name in build.gradle in oc_jb_workaround module 
 - [x] [DIS] Create changelog file (< 500 chars) and add to CHANGELOG.md in owncloud/android 
 - [x] [QA] Design Test plan @jesmrec
 - [x] [QA] Regression Test plan  @jesmrec 
 - [x] [GIT] Merge branch release_0.9.20 in owncloud/android-library, into master, if needed
 - [x] [GIT] Merge branch release_2.8.0 in owncloud/android, into master 
 - [x] [DIS] Generate test APKs files from branch master in owncloud/android and perform some basic operations.
 - [x] [GIT] Create and sign tag oc-android-2.8.0 in HEAD commit of master branch, in owncloud/android 
 - [x] [GIT] Create and sign tag oc-android-library-0.9.20 in HEAD commit of master branch, in  #owncloud/android-library 
- [x] [DOC] Include new changelog on Releases section of github android repo by drafting the new release 2.8.0 
 - [x] [DIS] Generate final APK files (including oc_jb_workaround) from signed commit in owncloud/android
 - [x] [DIS] Upload & publish release APK and changelog in Play Store
 - [x] [DIS] Update screenshots and store listing, if needed, in Play Store
 - [x] [DIS] push OC JB workaround app to Play Store.
 - [x] [DIS] Upload APKs to repo
 - [x] [SPREADTHEWORD] Write a topic in central about the release. https://central.owncloud.org/t/owncloud-android-app-2-8-0-released/
 - [x] [COORDINATION] Write in corresponding channels.
 - [x] [COORDINATION] Write email to release-coordination mailing list.
 - [x] [SPREADTHEWORD] Write a post in the blog
 - [ ] [DOC] Update documentation with the new features. @settermjd 
 - [x] Publish app in F-Droid 
 - [x] [GIT] merge master branch into stable, in owncloud/android-library
 - [x] [GIT] merge master branch into stable, in owncloud/android

_____
### BUGS & IMPROVEMENTS:

- [x] (1) SAML session expiration does not prompt to login https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2238#issuecomment-396660454 [FIXED]
- [x] (2) Toast instead of snackbar https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2238#issuecomment-400748691
- [X] (3) Maintenance mode points to authentication error https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2238#issuecomment-400932784 [FIXED]
- [x] (4) Toast in copy/move/rename/removed https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2238#issuecomment-400949114 [FIXED] 
- [X] (5) Bad error when trying to share with a sharee https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2238#issuecomment-401341095 [FIXED] 
- [X] (6) Error when account is deleted https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2238#issuecomment-402092692 [FIXED]
- [X] (7) fingerprint lock blocks after upgrading https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2238#issuecomment-402517259 [FIXED]

title: Automatic picture upload not starting if "only on wifi" unchecked
body:
### Actual behaviour
- If "upload only on wifi" is unchecked then picture upload never starts.

### Expected behaviour
- If "upload only on wifi" is unchecked then pictures should be uploaded, regardless of which network is active, wifi or cellular.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install and configure owncloud client on android
2. Enable instant uploads for pictures and videos.
3. Restrict videos to upload only via wifi (check box), but not pictures (ucheck box).
4. Take a picture.
5. Picture upload never starts.
6. Make a video.
7. Video uploads normally.
8. Check "upload only on wifi" for pictures too.
9. Picture uploads start and work nicely.

Official owncloud server not tested.

### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1
Device model: Samsung Galaxy Note 4, SM-N910C
Stock or customized system: Stock
ownCloud app version: 2.7.0
ownCloud server version: 10.0.8.5 community

title: No such property: name for class: java.lang.String
Improvements in "Descending" file list sort method
body:
Currently, the "descending" option to sort the file list is placed within the action bar menu as following:

![device-2018-05-15-184407](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14894746/40071510-409aed42-5871-11e8-81e4-1b23ce8c2d5f.png)


We can improve this behaviour in two different ways:

- By changing the wording to `Sort descending` , so only the word `Descending` can be confusing 
- By setting the option in the same dialog as the sorting method, in the bottom as a checkable option:

![device-2018-05-15-184549](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14894746/40071575-77412c4e-5871-11e8-8f9a-f52a8018bd37.png)


CC @michaelstingl

title: Feature Request: Select account for instant upload
body:
### Actual behaviour
In https://central.owncloud.org/t/android-instant-upload-with-multiple-accounts-select-target-account/7427 a user reports that in a multi-account setup they can not select the account to which photos shall be instantly uploaded.

The photos are currently only going to the last account which was used. This means that they end up in the wrong folder sometimes. In nextcloud it seems to show the same behavior: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/440

### Expected behaviour
Users should be able to select to which account they want to upload, either after taking a photo or in general.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Take a photo
2. Go to the ownCloud app and select another account
3. Take another photo
4. look where they have been uploaded to


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)


### Environment data
Android version: Android 7.1

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini (i8190)

Stock or customized system: Lineage OS 14.1

ownCloud app version: 2.7.0

ownCloud server version: one of them 10.0.7, the other 10.0.6

title: DetectAuthenticationMethodOperation:run() assumes one WWW-Authenticate header per auth. method
body:
_This comes from @guimaluf's report on central: https://central.owncloud.org/t/www-authenticate-response-header-issues-when-authenticating-mobiles-apps-with-oauth2-on-apache-php5-6-fpm/13308/_

---

> When accessing `/remote.php/webdav` with php-fpm and without I get distinct results for WWW-Authenticate header, which fail to auth with mobile clients

> With php5.6-fpm

```
curl -i -X GET https://.../remote.php/webdav
WWW-Authenticate: Basic realm="ownCloud", Bearer realm="ownCloud"
```

> Without php5.6-fpm, with mod_php

```
curl -i -X GET https://.../remote.php/webdav
WWW-Authenticate: Basic realm="ownCloud"
WWW-Authenticate: Bearer realm="ownCloud"
```

--- 

According to [HTTP's Message Syntax and Routing RFC](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7230#section-3.2.2): 

> A sender MUST NOT generate multiple header fields with the same field
>   name in a message unless either **the entire field value for that
>  header field is defined as a comma-separated list** [i.e., #(values)]
>   or the header field is a well-known exception (as noted below).

**This read together with message (header) syntax BNF tells that both forms are absolutely right.** 

Issue here lies in: 

https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/5b334c075d0c0320b049e30ba5d0624a9390b632/src/com/owncloud/android/operations/DetectAuthenticationMethodOperation.java#L101-L115

... where the app assumes there's always one `WWW-Authenticate` header per authentication method. When a comma-separated list of methods can be provided inside just one `authHeader`. **Actually, one would expect this to be all be determined at a library-level for a clean, portable solution.**

title: Android App successfully tests SSL connection but fails to log in 'Unknown error'
body:
### Actual behaviour
When trying to log in using the android application (version 2.7.0) entering `https://cloud.chillstice.com` yields the message: `Secure connection established`; however, when logging in with the correct credentials it tries to log in for 3 seconds and fails with the message: `Unknown error`. The desktop client works fine and the ownCloud panel accessible at cloud.chillstice.com works properly.

### Expected behaviour
The application should log in like I was able to do many times before moving to a subdomain.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a subdomain redirect to the directory ownCloud is installed in.
2. Try to connect using the new address with the android application.

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
NO :C 


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S7 Verizon (SM-G930V)

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: 2.7.0

ownCloud server version: 10.0.7.2

### Logs
#### Web server error log
No relevant errors

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
No relevant errors

### More Info
Today I finally figured out how to properly create subdomains and how to set ownCloud to be accessible under the 'cloud' subdomain. I changed the config.php to include the following:
```
  'trusted_domains' => 
  array (
    0 => 'chillstice.com',
    1 => 'cloud.chillstice.com',
  ),
'overwrite.cli.url' => 'https://cloud.chillstice.com/',
'htaccess.RewriteBase' => '/',

```
Then I ran 'occ maintenance:update:htaccess'
The SSL certificates for the subdomain have also successfully been updated and are live.
I only started having this problem after setting up the subdomain.

title: As a user, I would like to know the space remaining in my account
body:
It would be great to have this feature included in our side menu for example, as suggested [here](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2204).

There's a pretty old PR, https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/737 that follows a different approach, creating a specific activity to show the quota. Although we can use the library PR maybe, https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/102 and take advantage of `GetRemoteUserQuotaOperation`

___

**TASKS**

- [X] [LIBRARY] Get quota from the server by using GetRemoteUserQuotaOperation. **Already merged via https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/102**
- [X] [APP] Get quota when getting user profile info and stores it in DB. 
- [X] [APP] Include quota in drawer menu, handling different cases with quotas using MB or GB
- [X] [APP] Handle pending, unknown and unlimited quota, switch to WebDAV endpoint. Related: https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/31376
- [X] [APP] Handle quota 0

title: Use a more recent and trustable network library
body:
After researching about the available Android network libraries out there and performing some tests by using our sample client app (more details in https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/issues/51), we have finally made the decision to get rid of Jackrabbit WebDAV library and implement [OkHttp](https://github.com/square/okhttp) 3.10.0
___

**TOPICS TO DISCUSS**

1. Include tests by using [OkHttp MockWebServer ](https://github.com/square/okhttp/tree/master/mockwebserver)
___

**TASKS**

1. Involving the app

- [x] Adapt the new OwnCloudClient uses. 
- [x] Add dav4android link in Settings page.

2. Involving the library https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/issues/51
___

**RELATED ISSUES**

- [x] Send a unique X-Request-ID header to allow tracing requests in apache and owncloud logs owncloud/android#2055

- [x] Multiaccount OAuth2 - basic owncloud/android#2095

CC / @michaelstingl @jesmrec @theScrabi

title: Skip Welcome Wizard to let run the Espresso tests
body:
App has currently three modes:

- Debug
- Beta
- Release

currently, the welcome wizard is shown in all of them when the app is installed from scratch. To skip it, an automatic click on SKIP is performed in the first test, so only once per execution of the suite. After that, the check over the credential fields' visibility is moved to the first test as well.

The best approach would be to show the welcome wizard only in Release and Beta, and avoid it in Debug mode. Maybe this tweak can be faced in the next version.

title: Fix espresso tests skip welcome wizard
body:
App has currently three modes:

- Debug
- Beta 
- Release

currently, the welcome wizard is shown in all of them when the app is installed from scratch. To skip it, an automatic click on `SKIP` is performed in the first test, so only once per execution of the suite. After that, the check over the credential fields' visibility is moved to the first test as well.

The best approach would be to show the welcome wizard only in Release and Beta, and avoid it in Debug mode. Maybe this tweak can be faced in the next version.

title: returning form share result in reenter credentials
body:
returning form share result in reenter credentials

@jesmrec pointed out that you had to enter your patterncode/passcode/fingerprint again after returning from sharing data to other apps.

For regular shares I could not reproduce this
![s1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/38246367-d89dbee0-3741-11e8-990f-1105cf939111.gif)

However if I brake up the process of sharing I had to enter the credentials
![s2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/38246406-fa2bc4f8-3741-11e8-9448-4d1c08007881.gif)

title: Guest app shows empty file list
body:
### Steps to reproduce
Create a guest account in the server by sharing with an email account,  and login with it in the Android client

### Current behaviour
File List is empty. iOS client shows the list in the same server

### Expected behaviour
File list is shown

Android 7 Nexus 6P v7.1.2

Server:

{"installed":true,"maintenance":false,"needsDbUpgrade":false,"version":"10.0.7.2","versionstring":"10.0.7","edition":"Community","productname":"ownCloud"}

title: Improve file select/upload UI
body:
I wan't a clear and consistent UI for file upload so that I don't get confused which button is the import and with is the upload form files button.
@michaelstingl @jesmrec please tell me what you think about that.

This is my suggestion:
![screenshot_1522239691](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/38030605-5b3d29ba-3299-11e8-95a7-d74e25fc2ce1.png)
![asdf](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/38030609-5e11b17e-3299-11e8-8a19-78547b4b089b.png)

title: upload file from specified predefined path
body:
- I want to upload contact backup VCF file from specified path. 

### Expected behaviour
-It should be upload automatically and already exist then override existing one. 
- Every time when i launch my cloud app, my contact backup generate in background and save in specific path.
- If I click on backup option it can upload file
